subject: Re: [junit] Some questions about JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Personal preference. I choose xxxTest or xxxTestCase. ... Classes don t throw exceptions; methods do. For each scenario under which I expect an exception
messageBody:
>So said javainsel on 4/14/2003 --------------------
>1. How would you call the test cases: xxxTest or TestXXX?

Personal preference. I choose xxxTest or xxxTestCase.

>2. If there is a class which has to be tested and which throws
>different exceptions: Would you create one test method per each
>exception or one test method per each method which throws it?

Classes don't throw exceptions; methods do.

For each scenario under which I expect an exception to be thrown, I would likely write a separate test.

>3. Would you use class variables to improve perforamance of the
>tests? Or would you not do that because it can mess up the test or
>make it difficult to read?

How do class variables improve the performance of tests?

>4. Do you use the JUnit addons? How likely is it that we will need
>them?

You don't need them, but it's good to know what Vladimir offers, in case you'd rather use someone else's code over building your own.
